TopicTitle: Mk I cockpit with bubble canopy post 1.1?

Articles.Content: Is anyone out there planning to preserve (perhaps with minor tweaks) the current Mk I nose, with bubble canopy, after it gets changed to this with the upcoming release? I figure I can't be the only one who prefers the current look, no offense to Porkjet.

I've currently copied all !y versions of KSP to another directory, that might be what you'll want to do, then you can always port the part back in when it updates. BUT, so far I've only seen the full Mk.1 cockpit, the new inline model hasn't been released yet, that's a crew can behind the cockpit now.

Right, I know. I'm indifferent to the (new) inline cockpit, but I prefer the current look of the Mk1 "nose" - specifically, that it has a canopy, not windows.

If I thought it'd do any good, I'd say so in the general discussion thread(s); but I figure the decision has already made, and so I'm just trying to preserve this version for those (like me) who prefer it.

Edited September 6, 2015 by Commander Zoom

I just did a pre-release of the old Mk1 Inline Cockpit, including the IVA by Sam Hall and some config tweaks by myself.

When the non-inline Mk1 Cockpit is replaced in KSP 1.1, I plan to do the same with the current version.

For now, the pre-release can be found in the SETI-Thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/106130?p=2183551&viewfull=1#post2183551
Well, to be fair it doesn't now, nor has it ever had a bubble canopy. I'd like to see one with a bubble, that's for sure.

You are a hero.

Well, to be fair it doesn't now, nor has it ever had a bubble canopy. I'd like to see one with a bubble, that's for sure.

You are, of course, correct; I apologize for being sloppy with my terms. The version introduced in the .25 update, then, with a rigid-framed canopy.

And thank you very much, Yemo. I'm looking forward to it.
